div.p: When you create a document type a dialog pops up where you can specify the details for the document type. The details are the name of the document type and whether the document type is taggable. Tags are explained below. Compound types can not be taggable, so you only have to specify a name.

subsection.name: Taggable
subsection.p: Authors can add tags to a taggable document. Tags are words that are strongly related to the content of the document. They are used for searches. Searches on tags will give less and more relevant results than full text searches. It is best to add quite a few tags to a document. But too many would become useless, because you would get the same situation as with full text searches. There are functionalities available to suggest tags to authors. These functionalities use different methods for the suggestions. All off them require that documents are taggable.
